newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hoechst shares fall sharply on 96 figures.
newsitem.headline: Hoechst shares fall sharply on 96 figures.

text.p: Shares in German chemicals giant Hoechst AG fell sharply in afternoon IBIS DAX trade after the group reported lower than expected pre-tax earnings for 1996 and proposed a lower dividend.
Shares fell over five percent to 75.02 marks in afternoon IBIS DAX trade, while the overall IBIS DAX index was up 35.10 points, or 1.02 percent, at 3,461.87.
The shares soon recovered a little, but were still trading down 4.23 percent at 75.80 marks. Hoechst had traded as high as 80.97 marks earlier in the day.

Market expectations were disappointed when the group proposed a dividend of 1.40 marks for 1996, compared to forecasts of 1.60 marks. Pre-tax profits rose 29 percent to 5.28 billion marks, against forecasts of a 50 percent rise.
